articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Russia might supply weapons to North Korea in what he suggested would be a mirror response to the Western arming of Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin says Russia may deliver weapons to North Korea

articles.author: Khanh Vu, Minh Nguyen
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said during a state visit to Vietnam on Thursday that strengthening strategic ties is "one of his priorities" as he continued a swing through Asia seen as a show of defiance.
articles.title: Russia's Putin in Vietnam calls for strengthening "strategic partnership"

articles.author: Jack Kim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: North Korea and Russia agreed to provide immediate military assistance if the other side faced armed aggression, under a pact their leaders signed during Russian President Vladimir Putin's first visit in 24 years.
articles.title: North Korea, Russia sign pact to give all available military help if other is attacked

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Several Israeli air strikes in the central and northern Gaza Strip overnight and into Thursday killed at least 14 people and wounded dozens of others, according to medics, while tanks deepened their invasion into Rafah in the south, residents said.
articles.title: Israel pounds central Gaza camps, deepens invasion of Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military's floating pier off Gaza has resumed bringing humanitarian aid into the Israeli-besieged Palestinian territory, the Pentagon said on Thursday, even as aid continues to collect in a nearby marshalling area since the United Nations has not restarted transporting it to warehouses.
articles.title: Gaza pier resumes operations as aid collects in marshalling area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese product designer Tara Tabet does not want to see her country pulled into a full-scale war with Israel, but like many of her compatriots is bracing for possible conflict after new threats by armed group Hezbollah against both Israel and Cyprus.
articles.title: Weary Lebanese brace for war after new Hezbollah threats

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Dangerous heatwaves are scorching cities on four continents as the Northern Hemisphere marks the first day of summer, a sign that climate change may again bring about record-breaking heat that could surpass last summer as the warmest in 2,000 years.
articles.title: Millions sweltering under extreme heat worldwide as summer arrives

articles.author: Abdi Sheikh, Aaron Ross, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: Somalia's government is seeking to slow the withdrawal of African peacekeepers and warning of a potential security vacuum, documents seen by Reuters show, with neighbouring countries fretting that resurgent al Shabaab militants could seize power.
articles.title: Exclusive: Somalia asks peacekeepers to slow withdrawal, fears Islamist resurgence

articles.author: Karen Lema, Christopher Bing
articles.description: Lawmakers in the Philippines, including the head of the Senate’s foreign relations committee, are seeking an investigation into a secret U.S. military propaganda operation that aimed to cast doubt among Filipinos about China’s vaccines during the height of the COVID pandemic.
articles.title: Lawmakers in Philippines push for probe into Pentagon's anti-vax propaganda operation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Thursday suggested that people who graduate from college in the United States should "automatically" get a green card to be able to stay in the country.
articles.title: Trump says foreign college graduates should automatically get green cards
